Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.util

The util package contains several classes aimed at helping RapidSmith users do a variety of operations such as install RapidSmith, convert files, and run certain Xilinx tools from within RapidSmith.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
BrowseDevice This class is a simple method to browse device information by tile.
DesignCompare This class compares two designs to check if they are identical.
DesignDiff  
FileConverter  
FileTools This class is specifically written to allow for efficient file import/export of different semi-primitive data types and structures.
HardMacroGenerator This class reads an XDL design file and converts it to a hard macro.
Installer This class will create the device and wire enumerator files necessary for RapidSmith to operate.
MergeStaticNets This class will read in an XDL design and unroute and merge all static source (GND/VCC) nets into GLOBAL_LOGIC0 and GLOBAL_LOGIC1 and also remove all sources (TIEOFFs/SLICEs).
MessageGenerator  
PartNameTools This class is to aid manipulating and converting Xilinx part names and the FamilyType enum.
PatchGenerator This class generates a patch java class used for mapping missing internal pin names to external pin names for primitive sites missing the mappings from the XDLRC report file.
RunXilinxTools This is a generic class which has several static methods to call Xilinx tools from within the RapidSmith framework.
StreamGobbler  
StringPool  
TileAndPrimitiveEnumerator This class generates java files for the device package for Xilinx FPGAs to create enumerations for tile type names and primitive type names.
UnrouteNets  
XDLDesignChecker This class is meant to debug problem with XDL files.
 

Enum Summary
FamilyType These names are taken from the Xilinx tool 'partgen.' They are the architecture names given, however, here they are called the family name.
HardMacroGenerator.direction directions for finding slices
 

Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.util Description

The util package contains several classes aimed at helping RapidSmith users do a variety of operations such as install RapidSmith, convert files, and run certain Xilinx tools from within RapidSmith.
